reviews.sentence: Great location. Furniture and furnishings in rooms are old and worn out. The hotel needs to be renovated. Housekeeping forgot to keep some of the toiletries. Took over an hour to get them. Heating was not working well in the room.

Genuine Londonish Experience. I stayed at the Milenium Mayfair during a few days of business visit to London and found it suitable for this type of visit for a few reasons mainly its key location in the heart of such a wonderful neighborhood as Mayfair grants east access to all the good things London can offer within walking distance or within underground station reach. The hotel is practically 2 minutes from Selfridges which gives it a few extra points to begin with. Additionally the hotels services are really great the breakfast is generous in all terms of variety and cleanliness the reception staff is friendly and helpful and the room service is doing a great job in maintenance. I must also add that the hotels additional services were very good washing and ironing services made in a snap and prepared a set of dress shirts and a suit to a great condition after long haul travel refreshing. and room service was in great level and even alas tasty. The hotels bar is a place one would enjoy even if not actually sleeping over. Last thing is about the hotels decoration always an important factor for myself and particularly in a city like London here it is presented in full glory of the citys Victorian design legacy. It is very well preserved and I believe visitors are enjoying a genuine 360 degrees scenery of the citys old days. This does not come without a few minor faults elevator not the quickest textiles in the room such as curtains and bed covers could be refreshed more often. but these honestly do not interfere with the experience. Would return to this hotel even for a longer stay perhaps in a private vacation as well.

Millennium Hotel London Mayfair. Nice hotel with very helpful staff. We mentioned that the air conditioning in our room was not working properly they sent an Engineer to look at it and he was unable to repair it so the hotel staff suggested to us to move to another room. We were very thankful for their professionalism.

Great location. However room was a disappointment overpriced for what it is and scruffy. Room was desperately in need of refurbishment. Wallpaper ripped and surfaces scuffed. There were sweet wrappers on the floor where the room had not been cleaned properly.

Location is Great. The location of the hotel is great. It is quite near Oxford and Regent Street. Tons of 5 star restaurants in Mayfair within walking distance. However the hotel needs a facelift. Stayed there 10 years ago and thought really nice. Not now. Dumpy. Rooms shabby. Pulled drawers out of dresser and they broke twice. No hot water pressure in sinks. Had to call maintenance toilets not flushing. Changed rooms little better but still dumpy. That being said. the reception staff duty managers and the concierge were great Kevin and Nic in particular.

Convenient for business and shopping. Recommended for business purpose and shopping as well. Very close to tube so you can easily reach any place you would like to. Rooms need renovation breakfast could be better. Proximity to cosy restaurants is an advantage.

Mixed experience could n’t tell happy from sad. I stayed 2 nights on a business trip. I had booked a club room with access to the club lounge. Upon arrival I was greeted nicely the receptionist told she is giving me a nice room with a view. Upon entering the room I found it was old the water taps are almost rusty of course no view. I complained asked to move they promised that I am in a nice room they did n’t move me. The club lounge was also old however service was excellent while snacks variety was limited correct. The breakfast was normal nothing extra. The next morning was surprised that the club lounge was closed as they suddenly decided to start renovating the 7th floor. They kept promising to open in another place All day. I was extremely frustrated and requested a refund but all what they offered was a late check out. The hotel was always busy with weddings receptions which was a nice atmosphere.

Comfortable room to retreat too at the end of a busy day. Good size comfortable room with tea and coffee facilities. We upgraded to access lounge and include breakfast. Very hard bed. Very small shower cubicle with make do shower curtain in need of refurb.
Never staying here again. Location. The interior is really old it needs renovation. My room access was a disaster the card would n’t work and the staff never repaired it.
Lovely hotel the refurbishment is amazing and a lovely espresso martini in the Pine Bar.

Very helpful staff. We were at The Biltmore for two days last friday and saturday on business and found the staff very helpful. Especially Aaron the doorman who could not do enough and was a wealth of knowledge. A fantastic ambassador for the hotel in all ways. Thank you for making our stay so stress free. In addition the refurbishment is excellent and the hotel very well placed. we will be back David.

Very attentive staff upgraded corner room. We had a fabulous visit to this newly renovated Mayfair hotel. The staff was extremely attentive. The room was very comfortable and they even moved us to a larger corner room when I requested a bathtub. The location is superb and I would definitely stay here again on my next trip back to London.
Brand new renovations are lovely. Service was excellent. Heated toilets were a nice touch.
Beautifully refurbished hotel with excellent service and great location.
Great location very clean helpful staff recently refurbished I really love my stay at this hotel.

Wonderful Hotel. We stayed here after meeting friends in the bar on a previous occasion. So glad we did The hotel is so well situated for all the wonderful Mayfair shops and Restaurants. You can walk to Oxford Street in 5 minutes. The Hotel has been recently refurbished to an exceptional standard the rooms are spacious and attractively designed. We already had restaurants booked so did not try the restaurant but we really enjoyed the bar which has a great atmosphere. Above all the staff to a person were excellent Helpful friendly and courteous making our stay so enjoyable. We will be booking again soon.

Luxury but poor management misplacing guests items. I was recommended by a friend to stay at this hotel as it was renewly renovated and indeed the hotel is high standard and very elegent. I did not like the system of the breakfast buffet although I did not mind it as my reservation was including the brekfast. The staff at the reception and the door were the best however I had an unpleasant experience at this hotel as my expensive perfumes were misplaced and the minute I came to know when I got my country I reported it to the hotel on within less than 24 hours but till date I have not received a proper apology or had the sense of hotels obligation towards the incident and I was told that they do not have CC TV camera at my room to find out who took it. I reported that to the Holton. Com and at least I was rewarded with some points to be added withing my membership. Unfortunately due to this I will NEVER stay with them again and I will not refer them to anyone I know because no one can have the trust and comfort to such cases and most importantly that the hotel did not bother to do a proper invistigation nor thought of any thing in return to the guest.

Lovely updated hotel with great staff. The new updated hotel is terrific. We have stayed at the hotel for almost twenty years in its previous incarnation and were a little worried about what Hilton would do. While the renovation is a bit flashier than we would have liked the rooms are extremely comfortable and refreshed. Bathrooms excellent. The gym which is huge is great. The lobby is now a comfortable appealing place for tea or a drink. Most of all it is the marvelous location and THE HELPFUL STAFF which make the hotel. The concierges are top notch. The housekeeping too. The breakfast buffet needs to be improved but this can be done fairly easily. As always it is a pleasure to face the green of Grosvenor Square and to have the added convenience of the taxi car drop off on Adams Row. Needless to say the hotels location with South Audley and Bond Streets moments away is fantastic.
